subject: Critical Thinking
title: Slippery Slope: The Domino That Never Falls
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Slippery Slope: The Domino That Never Falls.

hook.text: 'Allow calculators in class and soon they'll forget math and civilization collapses!' Quite the leap in logic.

buildup.text: Slippery slope: arguing that one event will inevitably lead to a chain of increasingly extreme consequences.

discovery.text: The fallacy isn't claiming consequences exist â€“ it's assuming each step inevitably follows without proving the causal.

twist.text: Sometimes slopes ARE slippery â€“ addiction, authoritarianism, ecological collapse.

climax.text: Test each link: 'Does A really cause B? Does B really cause C?' If any link breaks, the slope doesn't slide.

punchline.text: Dominoes only fall if they're actually touching.

quiz.question: When is a slippery slope argument valid?
options: When each causal link in the chain is supported by evidence
When the final outcome is extreme enough
